body: I tried your code and see no issue. Can you send me the test files as well (`pro.apk` and `test.so`)?

> I tried your code and see no issue. Can you send me the test files as well (`pro.apk` and `test.so`)?

I have updated the comment by attach the test files, And my system is windows 10.
Issue is identified. Fix is on the way.

> Fixed in v2.2.8 released today
Thinks.

Hi, I also facing this same. I have been experiencing this error, when my zip exceeds about 4GB. I am using version 1.3.2. Does this fix solve my issue? Please let me know the root cause, so It help me lot.
Please let me know the possible cause for this error, so I can debug easily. I am eagerly waiting for your reply @srikanth-lingala

@sabariramesh 

> I am using version 1.3.2. Does this fix solve my issue?

The easiest way to find out is to try upgrading to the latest version of zip4j and see if that fixes it. It is hard for me to say wether it will fix the issue your case or not.

> Please let me know the possible cause for this error, so I can debug easily.

I am not sure how familiar you are with zip specification, but the bug was that zip4j was not copying the extra data records of existing file headers when adding files to an existing zip. This used to only happen in case when the existing file headers had some extra data records.
@srikanth-lingala , Issue identified. I am opening new ZipFile instance for every file addition.
Same issue when calling the .extractAll() method. Could you fix it?

in 2.11.5 I have the same issue on extract all too :
`
Caused by: net.lingala.zip4j.exception.ZipException: Expected central directory entry not found (#1)
	at net.lingala.zip4j.headers.HeaderReader.readCentralDirectory(HeaderReader.java:153)
	at net.lingala.zip4j.headers.HeaderReader.readAllHeaders(HeaderReader.java:107)
	at net.lingala.zip4j.ZipFile.readZipInfo(ZipFile.java:1135)
	at net.lingala.zip4j.ZipFile.extractAll(ZipFile.java:462)
`
@kris2kris  Do you have a sample zip file that you can share to reproduce this issue?
